result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas R. Bass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sentences Mr. Bass to 3.5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least 1x/mth upon release from prison)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency:  Fort Atkinson PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.



******PER 8-9-2016 ORDER JOC AMENDED- Change random urinalyses (at least 1x / mth upon release from prison) to random urinalyses (consistent with Case No 14CF66)*****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas R. Bass

defendant.name: Bass, Thomas R.
defendant.address: 1011 Grant St. Upper, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Amendment to JOC - Change random urinalyses (at least 1x mth upon release from prison) to random urinalyses (consistent with Case No 14CF66)
Court corrects 7/26/16 order to reflect Court orders JOC be amended in 14CF66 to reflect that the Court ordered withheld sentence for 2 years consecutive to 14CF24.
from DOC requesting to Amend JOC re: condition of random urinalyses at least 1x/mth upon release from prison
Court orders JOC be amended in 16CF66 to reflect that the Court ordered withheld sentence for 2 years consecutive to 16CF24.

It is Ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. It is futher ordered that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
from DOC re: Def. completion of Earned Release (with attached certificate & proposed order to amend JOC)
of the 3/7/14 Plea & Sentencing Hearing held before the Honorable Judge Randy R. Koschnick

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: With elements/JI's and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF24 & 14CF66 called together at 2:20 pm
Defendant Thomas R. Bass in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF66: Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Both Cases: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Bass waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-14CF24 & Ct#1-14CF66; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.  On Motion of the State, the Court modifies complaint in 14CF24 to reflect a date of 1/5/14 line 1, paragraph 2, factual basis rather than 1/5/13 Sentencing Arguments by ADA Hall - Recess: 2:34 pm for Atty Svehlek to address another matter. Reconvene: 2:59 pm

14CF24: Court sentences Mr. Bass to 3.5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses (at least 1x/mth upon release from prison)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--Reimburse $250 drug testing fee
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

No Driver's License Suspension or Revocation
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

14CF66: Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, consecutive to 14CF24, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--Letter of apology to Dawn Bass, per Agent
--To pay costs of $268
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

0 days credit for time served
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given 
Recess: 3:09 pm
Status conference on March 7, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2014 at 09:20 am.

Case called at 1:56 pm
Defendant Thomas R. Bass in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court reviews conflict review worksheet, Court finds that this case is not the same action or proceeding here or the same matter in controversy. Court finds that there is no conflict and signs the conflict review worksheet.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charge and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant qualifies for SPD representation.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

Recess: 2:02 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 2/5/14 at 9:20 am
Status: 3/7/14 at 2:00 pm
